org.jmisb.api.klv.st0903.vtarget

Class BoundaryTopLeftLonOffset

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jmisb.api.klv.st0903.vtarget.AbstractTargetLocationOffset
      • org.jmisb.api.klv.st0903.vtarget.BoundaryTopLeftLonOffset
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IKlvValue, IVmtiMetadataValue

    public class BoundaryTopLeftLonOffset
extends AbstractTargetLocationOffset
    Boundary Top Left Longitude Offset (ST0903 VTarget Pack Tag 14).

    From ST0903:

    Longitude offset for top left corner of target bounding box from Frame Center Longitude (MISB ST 0601), based on WGS84 ellipsoid. Use with Frame Center Longitude. Added to the Frame Center Longitude from the parent ST 0601 packet to determine the Longitude of the top left corner of the target bounding box. Convert both data items to decimal representation prior to addition to determine the actual measured or calculated Motion Imagery bounding box corner location. Bounding box corners that lie above the horizon do not correspond to points on the earth. Bounding box corners may lie outside of the mapped range. Both cases should either not be reported or be reported as an “error”. Conversion: IMAPB(-19.2, 19.2, 3).

    Valid Values: The set of real numbers from -19.2 to 19.2 inclusive.

      • BoundaryTopLeftLonOffset

        public BoundaryTopLeftLonOffset(byte[] bytes,
                                EncodingMode encodingMode)
        Create from encoded bytes.

        ST0903 changed the encoding to 3-byte IMAPB in ST0903.4. Earlier versions used a variable length (1-3 bytes) byte array to represent an integer in the range [-2^23-1, 2^23-1]that was then mapped into the range [-19.2,19.2]. The three byte case could potentially represent either kind of formatting, and which formatting applies can only be determined from the version in the parent VmtiLocalSet. The compatibilityMode parameter determines whether to parse using the legacy encoding or current encoding.

        Note that this only affects parsing. Output encoding is always IMAPB (ST0903.4 or later).

        Parameters:
        bytes - Encoded byte array
        encodingMode - which encoding mode the bytes parameter uses.
